content:
That's great to hear! Guided tours can be incredibly enriching, especially when led by knowledgeable guides like Rachel. They can provide valuable insights, highlight hidden details, and offer a deeper understanding of the artwork.

It's wonderful that Rachel was able to point out subtle details that you might have otherwise overlooked. Sometimes, having a guide can help you appreciate the artwork on a deeper level, and even change your perspective on the piece.

Did Rachel share any interesting anecdotes or behind-the-scenes stories about the artists or the artwork? Guided tours can often provide a more personal and humanizing aspect to the art, making it more relatable and memorable.

Also, what was the focus of the guided tour? Was it a general overview of contemporary sculpture, or was it centered around a specific theme, movement, or artist?
